description: Numbers n such that x^n + x^5 + 1 is irreducible over GF(2).
comments: Next term is > 10^5. [_Joerg Arndt_, Apr 28 2012]Next term is > 241000. - _Manfred Scheucher_, Aug 18 2015
links: Joerg Arndt, Matters Computational (The Fxtbook), section 40.9.3 "Irreducible trinomials of the form 1 + x^k + x^d", p.850
mathematica: Do[ If[ ToString[ Factor[ x^n + x^5 + 1, Modulus -> 2 ] ] == ToString[ x^n + x^5 + 1 ], Print[ n ] ], {n, 0, 900} ]
prog: (Sage)P.<x> = GF(2)[]for n in range(10^4):    if (x^n+x^5+1).is_irreducible():        print(n) # _Joerg Arndt_, Apr 28 2012
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 27 2000
